N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 167.3 - Approval requirements

State Regulations
(a) No
agency shall be permitted to provide basic skills programs under SECGP or to
provide basic skills programs for youth under JTPA title II unless it approved
by the department or exempted from such approval pursuant to section
167.4
of this Part. (b) In order to be eligible for approval to
operate a basic skills program, an agency shall: (1)
be incorporated or chartered and have
conducted a basic skills program for the two years immediately preceding the
date of application for approval; (2)
provide a statement from a certified
public accountant or public accountant that its fiscal procedures are
consistent with standard fiscal practices; (3)
have engaged in consultation and
cooperative arrangements with other public and private agencies for the
delivery of programs and/or services; and
(4)
have a faculty of which a majority have
at least two years experience in teaching basic skills. (c) The commissioner may suspend or withdraw
such approval for failure to comply with institutional or program requirements
and standards as required by this Part. Notes
